page.title: 06LOWER BOWDEN FARM 3
page.content:
order to make it more digestible. All of the corn is sold off the farm for feed. 16 cows can be milked simultaneously and the milk is sent to Clifford's Dairy in Bracknell to be treated and eventually bottled. The farm finds trespassers a problem because some of them leave gates open with the result that the cows wander out into the road and are sometimes accidentally killed. Some staff have found Roman coins near the railway embankment on the farm; also found were some horse and oxen shoes (some horse shoes were for use on ice winter-working) indicative of the times when animals, instead of tractors, did the ploughing.
Grid ref.: 6176 & 6276 Land Use : Arable/Grass Land
